answers.text:
Hi Robert, 
I was poking around the E-Government topic page on the Knowledge Network, and I found a document by Mike Gilbar at the Vermont League of Cities & Towns, titled “Tech Check: Is It Worth It? Making E-Government Purchasing Decisions,” that I think may help you with your research.  The brief paper outlines the things that a person needs to consider before making a purchase, suggests that, in general, qualitative attributes should not be measured in perceived dollar amounts, and lays out methods for calculating the return on investment for e-government initiatives.  The cost-effectiveness analysis (CEA) method outlined in the paper may be especially helpful for you.  
You can find the “Tech Check” paper at http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/5906/Tech_Check_Is_It_Worth_It_Making_EGovernment_Purchasing_Decisions and find more resources about calculating ROI for E-Government on the E-Government topic page.  Thanks again for reaching out to us with your question!!
Aloha,
James Davidson
Knowledge Network Intern

author: Robert Berlin
text:
I am researching methods local governments use to value IT investments. There is the quantitative value of the investment however there is also a qualitative value associated with the benefits the IT investment provides to local government constituents including businesses and individuals, local government employees, and non-local entities and individuals.
If you have any information or can direct me to other localities, I would appreciate it. Chesterfield County is a member of ICMA.
title: IT Value Management
